body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned Petitioners would respectfully represent that at the ^last^ August Term of the Laurel Circuit Court They were tried for the offence of gaming and found guilty and fined in the sum of $2000 each They state that the facts as they existed and as proved were that your petitioners and two other men were engaged in a game at cards where ^there was^ liquor was for sale the run of the game was. that the two that beat were to drink while the other two were not to drink but pay the bill -- in this way the game was played merely for amusement and pass time without your petitioners knowing that such gaming was a violation of law -- as the times are somewhat hard in this section and the means of the undersigned limited They therefore pray your Excellency to remit said fines

I heard the evidence upon which the above mentioned fines were assessed and know that it was substantially as stated in the foregoing petition Said Crook and Tuttle are poor men and in my Judgment the good of society would not suffer by said fines being remitted

C B Faris Clerk
Laurel Cir, Court
The undersigned are citizens of Laurel County and well acquainted with said Crook and Tuttle and believe said fines ought to be remitted

Rholand Hodges
S Ewen Jones
Wm Lemar
Wm. R. Jones Sqr
S C Jackson

Laurel Cir Ct
vs
Tuttle & W. J. Crook
$20, each
Remit
4th Oct/64
